requirement_tested: A frontend that fetches all data from backend APIs
user_persona: A health-conscious reader visiting the blog for the first time.
user_goal: To view a list of published health articles without seeing any mock or hard-coded content.

narrative_steps.title: Landing on Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the health blog website and expects to see real articles loaded dynamically from a server.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage URL in browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page displays a grid of article cards populated via an API call to the backend.

requirement_tested: A backend that connects to an external PostgreSQL database using environment variables: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp
user_persona: A developer setting up the backend service locally.
user_goal: To confirm the backend connects securely to the PostgreSQL database using environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Service
narrative_steps.description: Alex runs the backend service after configuring the environment variables as instructed.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend server with configured environment variables.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The backend successfully establishes a connection to the PostgreSQL database using the provided environment variables.

user_persona: An admin managing content for the health blog.
user_goal: To publish a new health article using the article creation form.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Article Creation Form
narrative_steps.description: Admin logs into the CMS and navigates to the article publishing section.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the article creation form.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A form with title, content, category dropdown, and publish button appears with correct styling.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting New Article
narrative_steps.description: Admin fills out the form and submits the article for publication.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in form fields and click the 'Publish' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The article is submitted to the backend API and stored in the database.

requirement_tested: User interface for browsing and searching articles
user_persona: A visitor looking for specific health information.
user_goal: To find relevant articles using either keyword search or category filters.

narrative_steps.title: Using Search Bar
narrative_steps.description: Jamie types 'heart health' into the search bar hoping to find related articles.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'heart health' into the search bar and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Articles matching the keyword are displayed in the grid below.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Category Filter
narrative_steps.description: Not satisfied with search results, Jamie decides to browse by category instead.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Nutrition' category chip.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Only articles categorized under Nutrition are shown in the article grid.

requirement_tested: Commenting system for users to post comments on articles
user_persona: A regular reader who wants to share thoughts on an article.
user_goal: To leave a comment on a recently read article.

narrative_steps.title: Reading an Article
narrative_steps.description: Taylor finishes reading an article about mental wellness and wants to comment.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the bottom of the article page to the comment section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Existing comments are displayed and a text area for new comments is visible.

narrative_steps.title: Posting a Comment
narrative_steps.description: Taylor writes a thoughtful comment and submits it.
narrative_steps.action: Type a comment in the text area and click 'Post Comment'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The comment is sent to the backend and immediately appears in the comment list.

requirement_tested: Categorization feature for organizing articles by topic
user_persona: A user interested in exploring content within a specific health category.
user_goal: To view articles exclusively from the 'Fitness' category.

narrative_steps.title: Browsing Categories
narrative_steps.description: Jordan notices several category tags while browsing the homepage.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Fitness' category chip.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The article grid updates to show only Fitness-related articles.

requirement_tested: Functionality for users to follow specific topics
user_persona: A frequent visitor wanting personalized content.
user_goal: To subscribe to the 'Mental Health' topic for future updates.

narrative_steps.title: Finding Subscription Option
narrative_steps.description: Casey sees a 'Follow' button next to the Mental Health category.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Follow' button for the 'Mental Health' category.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The button indicates that Casey is now following the topic and the preference is saved via API.

requirement_tested: Search bar component for finding articles by keywords
user_persona: A user seeking quick answers on a health issue.
user_goal: To quickly locate articles about 'diabetes management'.

narrative_steps.title: Searching Articles
narrative_steps.description: Riley remembers reading something about diabetes and uses the search bar to find it again.
narrative_steps.action: Enter 'diabetes management' into the search bar and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Relevant articles appear in the results grid below the search bar.

requirement_tested: Article display page with title, content, author, and publication date
user_persona: A user who clicked on an article teaser.
user_goal: To read the full article with all relevant metadata.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Full Article
narrative_steps.description: Morgan clicks on an article card titled 'Benefits of Morning Workouts'.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the article card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Morgan is taken to a dedicated article page displaying the full content along with the author and publication date.

requirement_tested: Category filtering mechanism on the main blog page
user_persona: A user wanting to narrow down articles to a preferred category.
user_goal: To filter articles by the 'Diet' category.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Category Filter
narrative_steps.description: Patricia scrolls down past the search bar and sees various category chips.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Diet' category chip.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The displayed articles update to show only those tagged with 'Diet'.

requirement_tested: User comment display section under each article
user_persona: A reader curious about othersâ€™ opinions on an article.
user_goal: To read what other users have said about a particular article.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Comments
narrative_steps.description: Drew scrolls to the end of an article to see if anyone else commented.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the comments section of the article.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A list of user comments with usernames and timestamps is displayed.

user_persona: A logged-in user reviewing their topic preferences.
user_goal: To stop following a topic they're no longer interested in.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Profile Subscriptions
narrative_steps.description: Quinn visits their profile to manage followed topics.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the profile subscriptions section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A list of currently followed topics with unsubscribe options is shown.

narrative_steps.title: Unsubscribing from Topic
narrative_steps.description: Quinn finds 'Weight Loss' in the list and unsubscribes.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Unsubscribe' button next to 'Weight Loss'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The topic is removed from Quinn's subscription list via an API call.

requirement_tested: Global styling with misty rose background color
user_goal: To ensure the entire site has a misty rose background.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Background Color
narrative_steps.description: Taylor inspects the background color of different pages to verify uniformity.
narrative_steps.action: Open multiple pages and inspect body background style.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Every page renders with a consistent misty rose background as defined in the global CSS.

requirement_tested: Component styling using firebrick color for all UI elements
user_persona: A front-end reviewer checking design compliance.
user_goal: To verify that all UI components use firebrick for text and borders.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Component Styles
narrative_steps.description: Jordan reviews buttons, inputs, and links across the site.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect styles of various UI components like buttons and input fields.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All interactive components are styled with firebrick text and border colors.

requirement_tested: Repository configuration with package.json supporting `npm run install:all` and `npm run dev`
user_persona: A developer cloning the project for local setup.
user_goal: To install dependencies and start both frontend and backend services easily.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Alex clones the repo and needs to install dependencies for both frontend and backend.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` in the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dependencies for both frontend and backend are installed successfully.

narrative_steps.title: Running Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: After installation, Alex wants to start both services simultaneously.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` in the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend development servers start concurrently.
